etymologies: Old English nestlian, from nest; compare with Dutch nestelen

notes.text: no object, with adverbial of place

definitions: settle or lie comfortably within or against something

examples.text: the baby nestled in her arms
she nestled her head against his shoulder

shortDefinitions: settle or lie comfortably within or against something

definitions: (of a place) be situated in a half-hidden or sheltered position

examples.text: picturesque villages nestle in the wooded hills

shortDefinitions: be situated in half-hidden or sheltered position
